metadata.title: CVE-2020-8608 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In libslirp 4.1.0, as used in QEMU 4.2.0, tcp_subr.c misuses snprintfreturn values, leading to a buffer overflow in later code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8608` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23
No subscription required

slirp - 1:1.0.17-8ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.23').
slirp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.0.17-8ubuntu18.04.1').
